page.title: 19Annual School Camp
page.content: In June 1985 a group of 9-11 year old children visited an{adventure {centre at Pwll Du,near Blaenavon,}in Gwent. Activities started with a visit to {Raglan Castle.}Defences have existed here since the 11th century. The Adventure Centre is situated on old{open cast mine workings}which provide interesting study and walks.Further walking was done in the {Brecon Beacons}beside rivers and waterfalls. Other activities included{canoeing, {pony-trekking,shooting and abseiling. A highlight was the descent of a{40 {metre mine shaft}by abseiling. On the last day a visit was made to the{Big Pit}coal mine at Blaenavon.The pit ceased production in 1980 and is kept as a{Museum}now.
